titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Exhibits and Exhibitions
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Exhibits and Exhibitions FA884

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-10-31 02:15:38 -0400.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Special Events and Activities, Exhibits and Exhibitions

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Merrill W. Chase; Carolyn Kopp; Gladys Lewis (1982 April). Carolyn Kopp (1984 October 18). Witth additions to the collection in January 1985 and January 1986 (see Box 3).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains exhibition materials including still images.

did.unittitle: Exhibits
Arts and Crafts Exhibition. Library, Welch Hall

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Application form notice. 16 glossy prints, 1-5x7 inch, 15-8x8-inch, #60-1244, 1 proof print sheet.

did.unittitle: Arts and Crafts Exhibition. Faculty and Students Club

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Brochure, proof print sheets of orders 64-3323 and 64-3361 by Donald C. Young, 1-5x7 print from 64-3323, 1 8x10 print, two notices by Anne Morris.

did.unittitle: Arts and Crafts Exhibition. Faculty and Students Club

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1 test print 66-1981-J. Shaltis; 1 test print, no number, slightly enlarged to additional frames; 1 test print, no number, demonstration by J. Forest Vey, 18 frames; 14 glossy prints 8xl0-in papers from 66-1981; 1 gloss print 8x10 inc. J. Forest Vey.

did.unittitle: Arts and Crafts Exhibition. Faculty and Students Club

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Catalogue; Negatives 67-4060 2 x 2 11/15/67, 12 frames.

did.unittitle: Arts and Crafts Exhibition. Faculty and Students Club

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Catalogue, cross-reference sheet.

did.unittitle: Arts and Crafts Exhibition. Faculty and Students Club

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Catalogue.

did.unittitle: Arts and Crafts Exhibition. Student and Faculty Club (sic)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Catalogue; 6 4 x 5 prints.

did.unittitle: West African Sculpture Exhibition [No. 1]. Caspary Auditorium

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Catalogue; 2 professional contact proofs 35 mm; 1 RI contact proof 35 mm; large prints; photocopy of article by Robert Goldwater, RI Review, September-October 1964.

did.unittitle: Fifty American Prints. Caspary Auditorium

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Triple folder catalogue only.

did.unittitle: Early Asian Sculpture. Caspary Auditorium

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Collection of Lester Wolfe. Trial prints and large prints without negatives; catalogue; negative of head; photocopy from RI News May-June 1965.

did.unittitle: Contemporary Mexican Art. Graduate Students Residence Hall

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Private collection of Lester Wolfe. 70 pictures. circa 61 pictures in folder, prints and negatives. 2 catalogues.

did.unittitle: Art of the Northwest Coast Indians [No. l] Caspary Auditorium Gallery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Catalogue [Haida, Kitsan, Nootka, Makah etc.]. Article by Frederick J. Dockstader, "Northwest Coast Indian Art," RU Review, September-October 1965, 8 text-pages, 14 illustrations. 23 pictures of interior views enlarged from 35 mm film to 60x40mm. No negatives.

did.unittitle: Paintings and Monotypes by Tibor Csernus (1927- ). Caspary Auditorium Gallery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Flyer, undated. Photocopy of letter from Alexander Tomasz, June 1, 1966. Photocopy of letter from Laszlo Papp, October 14, 1966.

did.unittitle: Ancient Egypt. Caspary Gallery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Catalogue only.

did.unittitle: Art of New Guinea. Caspary Gallery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two copies of the catalogue. Photocopy of RU Review, Jan-Feb 1967, with cover and 8 pp. of text including 12 illustrations from "Art of New Guinea" by Douglas Newton. One original photo of Mrs. Patricia Berlin [Mitchell] and Prof. S. A. Goudsmit, with copy negative. (5) 67- 2070 4x5 negs, 1 June 1967, with Prof. Theodore Shedlovsky in 3 pictures.

did.unittitle: Three Centuries of Botany in North America. Abby Aldrich Rockefeller Hall

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Booklet on rag paper, by Bruce R. Voeller and Paul F. Cranefield, 38 pp. Photocopy of RU Review, March-April 1967, cover and 10 text-pages with 7 illustrations, "British Gardens and North American Flora" by Sir George Taylor. Color print of exhibit reception, identifications include M. W. Chase, Cynthia Pierce-Chase, Keffer Hartline, Paul Cranefield, Mabel Bright. (12) 67-1115 35mm negatives.

did.unittitle: Tibetan Art. Caspary Gallery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Catalogue, cover by Reynard Biemiller. 12-5x7-in. glossy prints of 6-armed statuette, different angles. One statuette standing on a donkey-like form. Two 8xl0-in glossy prints of 6-armed statuette standing on, or feet completed by, pig-like animals with human-type arms. Statue from the American Museum of Natural History. [Mrs. Patricia Berlin wrote that this statue was exhibited outside the reading room of Welch Library; that a small wooden part at the feet was separable, and that it was stolen. MWCI. (17) 68-393 4x5 negs. (12) 67-4444 2x2 negs.

did.unittitle: Special 3-dimensional exhibits. Library, Welch Hall
did.physdesc: 8 Kodachrome enlargements 6 5/8 × 4 5/8 in. (2 are photographed from different camera positions)

did.unittitle: Michael Faraday. In connection with symposia at The Rockefeller University under auspices of the American Association for the Advancement of Science, 100 years after Faraday's death

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 1) 26 Dec 1967: Faraday as a Natural Philosopher. 2) 29 Dec 1967: Faraday and the Unity of Natural Forces. Catalogue. Cover and 9 text-pages. No photos.

did.unittitle: Stringed Instruments, from the collection of Mr. and Mrs. Laurence C. Witten II. 20-24 May 1968, in connection with the Conference on Scientific Aspects of Musical Instruments. Catalogue, 16 pp., written by Mr. and Mrs. Witten II

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photocopy from RU Review, March-April 1968, "Feedback Phenomena between the Stringed Instrument and the Musician," by Georg von Békésy, 9 text-pages, 10 illustrations. 68-2620 (31) -35 mm, (24) 2x2 in.

did.unittitle: Indonesian Art. Caspary Gallery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Catalogue, 55 items from collection of Prof. Lee Gildart. (7) 8x10 prints. (16) 68-2720 4x4 negs, 6 June 1968.

did.unittitle: Temperas and Drawings and Lajos Szalay (1909- ). Caspary Gallery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Catalogue with 50 items, as photocopy. Triple-fold, with 7 illustrations.

did.unittitle: Images [Jekabs Zvilna]. Faculty and Students Club

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Broadside only.

did.unittitle: Woodcarvings of the Northwest Coast Indians [No. 2]. Caspary Auditorium Gallery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Catalogue. No photographs.

did.unittitle: Kinetic Art. Caspary Gallery. Catalogue
West African Sculpture [No. 2] [Photographed in 1971]. Caspary Auditorium

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Prints only (one-of-a-kind) [8 rolls 71-2226 A-H]. Two catalogues.

did.unittitle: West African Sculpture continued
Sculpture, Minoru Niizuma (1930-). Caspary Gallery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photocopy of catalogue listing 11 works. Glossy prints from 35 mm film, enlarged to 4¾"x3 3/8" (5 views in all) [One of exhibits was purchased by David Rockefeller; No. 5 was purchased by The Rockefeller University, "Mouth of River" and placed on cement block before Caspary Hall. MWCJ. Kodacolor prints contributed as final prints (2) or reproductions from Kodacolor negatives owned by Mrs. Patricia Berlin. Picture of sculpture in final location before Caspary Hall.

did.unittitle: Eskimo Artifacts. Caspary Gallery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two copies of catalogue. Nine 5x7-in. glossy prints, including one of empty case where contents were stolen from Caspary Gallery. [N. B. Photography made after the theft]. Three strips of 35 mm. negatives called 72-E. A.

did.unittitle: Nicolaus Copernicus (1473-1543). 500 years after his birth (Quin-centennial)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Catalogue, 43 photographs taken for the Lake District Social-Cultural Association in Warmia, Poland, 4 pp. Catalogue for simultaneous exhibition at the IBM Exhibit Center, Madison Ave. & 57th St., N. Y. C. 8-fold catalogue, 16 pp. Exhibits pictured, not numbered.

did.unittitle: Scientific Instruments (75th anniversary exhibit). Caspary Gallery

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photographs of recording ellipsometer of Alexander Rothen, before shipping to him in Switzerland (Item 32 of catalogue), with negatives. 3rd printing of catalogue, April 1977. (2) 35 mm negatives and proof sheets from M. W. Chase.

did.unittitle: Graphic Services

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 2 8x10 prints contributed by Robert J. Keiber and taken by him, partial identification.

did.unittitle: Other art on exhibit: Pop art in South Laboratory

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 65-1225, (8) 35 mm. pictures. Modern sculpture by James Rosati, 68-4808, 1968, out-of-doors on RU campus, (20) 35 mm photographs, (4) 4x5. 2 negatives of the Kline painting in AARH, 7 negatives of other paintings in AARH collection, 1 print each of preceding.
